TopicTitle: SAS Modules don't seem to do anything...

Articles.Content:
I put advanced SAS modules on my rocket but when I enable (T) the rocket doesn't stay straight it just does what it wants to, am I doing something wrong?

PS: The words SAS don't show up in my stages either.
SAS helps to stop the rotation of the rocket, you need an ASAS to keep it on track as best the semiautomated system can.

Did you activated it? (key T)

Edit: I guess I missed a part of the post sorry!

Edited June 15, 2013 by ImpulseSpaceCenter
He already said he did, Impulse. I'm thinking that he didn't use any winglets or gimballing engines that ASAS needs to keep rockets on course.
ASAS does very little by itself, but it calls upon any installed control surfaces, gimbaled engines, and/or RCS to maintain the ship's alignment.
Your rocket might just not have enough control authority to balance your craft. You need to add some gimballing engines (LV-45, Mainsail, Skipper, Etc) and/or some control surfaces.
